articles.headline: White House Let Rob Porter Keep Job Even After Receiving Final F.B.I. Report
articles.snippet: The F.B.I. chief upended the White House’s timeline of events, also saying the bureau delivered its first report on Mr. Porter months earlier than officials had said.
articles.abstract: The F.B.I. chief upended the White House’s timeline of events, also saying the bureau delivered its first report on Mr. Porter months earlier than officials had said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The White House changed its story on Tuesday about how it handled allegations of spousal abuse against Rob Porter, the staff secretary who resigned in disgrace last week, conceding that the F.B.I. told White House career officials last summer about problems in Mr. Porter’s background check. But members of President Trump’s team said top advisers in the West Wing were kept in the dark.
articles.byline: By Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Boom and Gloom: An Economic Warning for California
articles.snippet: Economists say a downturn is unlikely soon. But the state is known for highs and lows, and its longtime governor wants it to start preparing.
articles.abstract: Economists say a downturn is unlikely soon. But the state is known for highs and lows, and its longtime governor wants it to start preparing.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The United States is on track to achieve the second-longest economic expansion in its history. Unemployment is at a 17-year low. And California’s state budget has a multibillion-dollar surplus.

articles.headline: Corruption Charges Suggested for Netanyahu
articles.snippet: The charges, which would be the first against a sitting prime minister, raised immediate doubts about his ability to stay in power.
articles.abstract: The charges, which would be the first against a sitting prime minister, raised immediate doubts about his ability to stay in power.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — The Israeli police recommended on Tuesday that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu be charged with bribery, fraud and breach of trust, casting a pall over the future of a tenacious leader who has become almost synonymous with his country. The announcement instantly raised doubts about his ability to stay in office.
articles.byline: By David M. Halbfinger and Isabel Kershner

articles.headline: Ryan Murphy Heads to Netflix in Deal Said to Be Worth Up to $300 Million
articles.snippet: A five-year agreement with the producer behind “Glee” and “American Horror Story,” whose Fox contract expires this summer, leaves Disney and Amazon in the lurch.
articles.abstract: A five-year agreement with the producer behind “Glee” and “American Horror Story,” whose Fox contract expires this summer, leaves Disney and Amazon in the lurch.
articles.lead_paragraph: The streaming giant Netflix has won yet another battle against old Hollywood.

articles.headline: AT&T Is Said to Want Antitrust Official on Witness List for Trial
articles.snippet: The company is requesting that Makan Delrahim testify in the trial over the government’s decision to block its merger with Time Warner, sources said.
articles.abstract: The company is requesting that Makan Delrahim testify in the trial over the government’s decision to block its merger with Time Warner, sources said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — AT&T is seeking to put the head of the Justice Department’s Antitrust Division on its witness list in a trial over the government’s decision to block the phone giant’s $85 billion merger with Time Warner, according to two people with knowledge of the pretrial activity.

articles.headline: Netanyahu, Linked to $300,000 in Bribes, Says He Won’t Quit
articles.snippet: Facing bribery charges, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel still has a commanding hold on power.
articles.abstract: Facing bribery charges, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel still has a commanding hold on power.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu fought back Wednesday against a police finding that he had accepted nearly $300,000 in bribes, his cool self-confidence betrayed not the slightest worry that he could be forced to step down anytime soon.

articles.headline: Senators Strike Bipartisan Deal on Immigration Despite Veto Threat
articles.snippet: The legislation sets up a clash that will pit the political center of the Senate against the president and the Republican congressional leadership.
articles.abstract: The legislation sets up a clash that will pit the political center of the Senate against the president and the Republican congressional leadership.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A broad bipartisan group of senators reached agreement Wednesday on a narrow rewrite of the nation’s immigration laws that would bolster border security and resolve the fate of the so-called Dreamers, even as President Trump suggested he would veto any plan that does not adhere to his harder-line approach.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Michael D. Shear
